Project_Description: Akneeable team is designing a rehab device for Total Knee Arthroplasty Patients. It mechanically assists them to improve in a Range Of Motion exercise on day one after surgery. This will improve clinical outcome and reduce postoperative pain, as is motivated by early and high-intensity rehab studies.
Favourite_Memory: At the symposium, a few people came up who shared their mobility problem, or those of people around them. I could not help them that day, but it is something I pulled with me into tomorrow.
Biggest_Challenges: The sensor was quite noisy when moving. A low pass filter was applied, though a balance had to be struck between signal to noise ratio and latency.
Takeaway: I learned to make time to fail, even when I dont have time. The alternative is to fail 2x.
